intro: Swertia fritillaria, commonly known as the golden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Swertia fritillaria is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
